# Shopee Open Platform Data Protection Policy

**Announcement | Console**

[Terms of Use](/) | Data Protection Policy

---

This Shopee Open Platform Data Protection Policy explains how information is collected and used by the Shopee Open Platform (together the "Platform Terms"). The Platform Terms are incorporated by reference into any agreement or contract we have with you (including without limitation Shopee Content API Service Level Agreement and API Terms of Use, collectively referred to as "DPP") and form part of such agreement.

## 1. Purpose and Scope

### 1.1
This Shopee Open Platform Data Protection Policy ("DPP") constitutes the maximum data protection and information security standards that you are and your personnel are must and mandated to adopt to protect Protected Data that are collected, stored, used, disclosed and/or processed by you through your access or use of or integration with the Platform.

### 1.2
You shall be fully responsible for ensuring that you, your personnel and your users consent to and comply with this DPP, and shall be deemed to directly be in breach of this DPP. Failure to comply with the provisions outlined in this DPP will result in a breach of your legal contract with Shopee and any other applicable laws.

### 1.3
You confirm that when you have integrated with the Platform, to ensure the data are secured, for which we will require you to fulfil certain permissions/roles specified, you, your users, your personnel shall be entitled to access shall be entitled to and access data which you, your users, your personnel shall be entitled to access in a secure manner such as information relating to each product in your store, order data, logistics information, finance data, and access to basic configuration settings such as those pertaining to authentication and authorization. In accessing such data, you shall ensure that all reasonable security measures are in place both administratively and technically to protect confidential information and personal data from unauthorized collection, storage, use, disclosure and/or processing of such personal data (i.e. as well is not intended to manifest these as the sole usage of the platform).

### 1.4
You shall be fully responsible for ensuring that you, your personnel and your users consent to and comply with this DPP and agree that you accept the practices, requirements, and/or policies outlined in this DPP and the terms described herein. If you are accessing and using the Platform on behalf of a company (such as your employer) or other legal entity, you represent and warrant that you have the authority to bind that company or other legal entity to this DPP. In that case, "you" and "your" will refer to that company or other legal entity. You represent and warrant that you are duly authorized to accept this DPP on such company or entity's behalf and to legally bind such company or entity. If you do not have such authority, you must not accept this DPP and may not use the Services on behalf of your employer or acknowledgement and acceptance of the changes made to this DPP.

## 2. Definitions

### 2.1
"API" means the application programming interfaces made available by Shopee via the Platform.

### 2.2
"Application" means the software application, website or mobile app with which you access the Platform and which includes integrated Shopee API Services or developed by integrating with the Platform to provide functions to users for the use of any API.

### 2.3
"Content" means text and any other material (including databases, text, graphics, photographs, screenshots, audio, video, information and material provided by Shopee or third parties, or information and material of or provided by third parties or information and material of a third party, or which data Processing to transmission feedback) are provided in support of your Application.

### 2.4
"DPP" means collectively this Data Protection Policy (as updated from time to time) and any attachments hereto.

### 2.5
"Personal Data" or "PD" means data, whether true or not, that can be used to identify, contact or locate an individual, or from which such identification, contacting or locating may be reasonably practicable. "Personal Data" shall also include any actual or suspected (i) misuse of Shopee Content; or (ii) unauthorised access to or attempt to access Shopee Content or Shopee systems; or (iii) interference with or disruption to Shopee systems; or (iv) violation of DPP and/or any terms or conditions we have with you (including without limitation Shopee Content API Service Level Agreement and API Terms of Use); or (v) security incident or event involving Shopee Content.

### 2.6
"Processing" means any operation or set of operations which is performed upon Data, whether by automatic means or not, including but not limited to, collection, obtaining, recording, holding, storage, organization, adaptation, alteration, use, disclosure, dissemination, erasure, loss, destruction or disposal and "Process" and "Processed" shall be construed accordingly. "Restriction of processing" means the marking of stored Data with the aim of limiting their Processing in the future.

### 2.7
"Protected Data" means all data received, accessed, collected, used, disclosed, stored and/or processed by you via the Platform and which: (a) contains Personal Data; or (b) are commercially confidential to Shopee or its affiliates; or (c) provides us a direct financial basis, and (d) whose access or whose disclosure would likely give a potential adverse financial or reputational impact to Shopee or its customers or business, including but not limited to information relating to orders and products, payment and logistics information, seller/buyer profile and information, as determined by Shopee at its sole discretion ("Protected Data").

### 2.8
The parties hereby acknowledge that in the course of implementing and maintaining your integration with the Platform and Shopee polygons, statistics relating to the performance, financial or otherwise) of any Shopee services, data, computers, systems or premises, or such information may be shared related to the activity and any other information as may be generated through you based on information received from the Platform or the processing of such information and related activities.

### 2.9
"Security Breach" means any actual or suspected impairment, compromise or breach of security of any system (including but not limited to any computer systems and network systems) maintained containing Shopee Content, for example, any (i) misuse; (ii) loss; (iii) unauthorised access or disclosure; (iv) unauthorised acquisition; (v) unauthorised modification; (vi) other form of misuse; or (vii) other unauthorised activity.

### 2.10
"Shopee Content" means all Data stored in and retrieved from the databases of the Shopee group, which may include but not be limited to (i) Personal Data of users, merchants and any other stakeholders of the Shopee group; (ii) trade secrets or other proprietary information belonging to Shopee; and (iii) any other data related to your or any user of the Platform. "Systems" has the meaning given to it under Section 5.1.

### 2.11
All other capitalised terms shall have the same meaning as defined in the API Terms of Service.

---

## 3. Restricted Data

### 3.1
Subject to any applicable law (including without limitation, any applicable data protection or privacy laws and regulations), you shall not collect, use, disclose, store and/or otherwise process any Personal Data if: (i) not required for any feature or function or any purpose of the administrative Restricted Data, except in accordance with Shopee's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Restricted Data means full credit or debit card numbers, card verification value (CVV) codes, or bank account and full account numbers / bank codes / financial information held with financial institutions, identity card, national identification number, driver's license number, passport number, or any similar information issued by a government agency, individually or in combination with other information, information about racial, ethnic, religious, sexual orientation, transgender status, household or other income, or health or genetic data, and (ii) not within the scope of consents duly collected from the data subjects in accordance with applicable law; and (iii) not compliant with this DPP.

### 3.2
If you have previously collected any Restricted Data from your personnel and your users that is not within the scope as listed in Section 3.1, you should destroy or delete such data as soon as reasonably practicable, subject to the requirements of applicable law and any such breach. You and your personnel agree to waive any requirement to the securing or posting of any bond in connection with exercising any remedy available under this DPP and any other agreements concluded with us.

---

## 4. Security Management

### 4.1
You will develop, implement, maintain and enforce a written information privacy and security program that contains appropriate administrative, technical and physical safeguards against (i) any anticipated threat or hazard to the security and integrity of Protected Data; and (ii) unauthorized Processing that may result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any person, business or Shopee, designed to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Shopee Content and Protected Data.

### 4.2
You will ensure that the security program required under Section 4.1 should reasonably designed to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of Protected Data and to protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security and integrity of Protected Data.

### 4.3
You will provide details of any major change to your security program that may adversely affect the security of any Protected Data Processed under Section 3.1. If such changes may have any adverse impact the security of Protected Data, you shall (prior to implementing such change) consult with Shopee and follow Shopee's directions, which may include but not limited to requiring you to postpone or not implement such change or discontinue your use of and access to the Platform.

### 4.4
You agree that Shopee will have the right to audit your compliance with this DPP, including but not limited to your security program and communicating with Shopee on information security matters ("Security Officer").

### 4.5
You acknowledge that in the event Shopee discovers any non-compliance with this DPP in the course of such audit, Shopee reserves its right to suspend the access to the Platform.

### 4.6
If you experience any Security Breach, you will as soon as reasonably practicable (and in any event no later than within 24 hours of becoming aware), or have concerns with Shopee and to communicate the level of risk associated with such concerns and any necessary factional law enforcement actions to protect affected individuals. You agree to waive, without limitation to remedial action(s) we may take, and to cooperate and respond promptly to our directives and requests. Please contact us at apisupport@shopee.com for any breach notification. You shall also send written notification to the Data Privacy Officer at shopee-dpo-sg@shopee.com to inform the Security Breach, if such Security Breach involves Personal Data of individuals.

### 4.7
It is important that you notify Shopee immediately of any unauthorized access to any Shopee Content.

### 4.8
Incident Response Plan: For Application developers, a Security Breach could result in various categories of harm, including:

- (a) A loss of intellectual resources and hosting to comply with this DPP; and
- (b) A loss of consumer protection, integrity, and trust in your Application; and
- (c) A loss of brand reputation caused by the Security Breach.

In the event your security program should fall short of providing adequate protection to your users' Personal Data in accordance with the best practices and standards referenced in this DPP and other applicable requirements including the performance of similar services.

### 4.9
You agree to grant Shopee commercially reasonable access and cooperation rights to allow (along with its authorized third party representatives) to verify compliance with this DPP. You agree that Shopee, its affiliates and their authorized third party representatives shall have the right to audit, inspect and evaluate your compliance with this DPP both during and after the term of any other agreements concluded with us. For the avoidance of doubt, such inspections and audits (the "Audit") must be conducted under a proper access role, and access should be granted on a "need-to-know" basis.

### 4.10
For the purposes of ensuring that all your personnel is trained and security updated events arise - access and authorization, intrusion attempts, vulnerability and misuse event handling - you agree to implement a training mechanism and ensure appropriate security access is based on job roles. For the purposes of the security management access to Shopee Content. All logs must have access controls to Storage Content. All logs must have access controls to help prevent data breaches and ensure that your personnel is trained accordingly. This includes having your staff undergo regularly conducted training modules that may be provided by Shopee to access to begin incorporating lessons to suspicious activity (e.g., multiple unsuccessful login, unexpected required rate are based on the security of the Systems during Protected Data within the Platform, and to restrict and prevent logs must be secured to prevent or detect as early as possible any Security Breach that may threaten the security of protected Data.

---

## 5. Logical Security

### 5.1
In the context of this DPP, "Systems" means all software, hardware and systems used by you or your personnel to access Shopee Protected Data and/or Shopee Content via the Platform, or used in the processing of Shopee Protected Data and/or Shopee Content. For the purposes of this DPP, Systems includes but is not limited to devices, computers, work stations, mobile devices and servers.

### 5.2
Your Systems must comply with the following security requirements and controls:

- a) All prevent unauthorized access to Protected Data
- b) All Systems, applications and programs must be kept up to date.
- c) All anti-malware software must be current, operational and actively protecting the Systems. The anti-malware software must have the latest virus, signature, behavioral and heuristic detection capabilities and all Systems are configured to scan all files. System scans must be executed on applicable servers and workstations in accordance with industry standards and best practices.
- d) User access control systems must be based on job roles in accordance with industry best practices at all times for access rights and authorization. Access rights and authorization intrusion attempts must be routinely reviewed, evaluated and audited, and accounts of terminated personnel or personnel whose job function has changed must have their access promptly revoked. Detailed System logs of all access to and use of Protected Data must be documented in your written information privacy and security program (referred to in Section 4.1 above).
- e) All Systems must be clearly identified for internal access (i.e., no misuse from personnel) or for restricting Protected Data or transferring such data across insecure internal or external networks.
- f) All Systems must be equipped with security controls to prevent unauthorized access or modification, or disruption.
- g) All deploy appropriate firewall technology in the operation of your Applications, apps, and protect and authenticate access to or from the Systems, the networks and the external connectivity of the Systems uses of the Platform. Firewalls must be configured to the highest standard encryption to facilitate strong passwords.
- h) All deploy intrusion detection and prevention systems in order to, generate, monitor, and respond to alerts which access Shopee Content.
- i) All access to your security operations for all activities of your users and personnel.

### 5.3
Without prejudice to the above, you agree to comply with reasonable security requirements we may request from you from time to time to ensure the safety of Shopee Protected Data, including without limitation a minimum password policy of the systems, a minimum password policy of next (1) year.

### 5.4
You agree that you will implement effective network segmentation to restrict network access to Systems storing Protected Data and/or Shopee Content. You agree that you will, where possible, keep such network logically and physically segregated from any other networks and Systems to minimize the probability that malware could infiltrate the such a segregated network. You will implement a policy based approach to permit or deny traffic flow between segments and zones, and implement end user management of wireless networks to meet the following:

- i) Compliance with any password complexity and password changes requirements by Shopee for all accounts with privileged access to Shopee Content; and
- ii) All network access to systems networks shall be restricted to those authorized;
- iii) All personnel that have access to or Process Shopee Content must have a unique identity device certificate, key, or one-time password;
- iv) All remote access security measures must be configured to control, secure and regularly monitor changes for all activities of your personnel with access to Shopee Content, and maintain details of all such changes for review;
- v) All recognition of all wireless connections will be accident using industry standard encryption algorithms (i.e., Wi-Fi Protection Access 2 (WPA2) at minimum);
- vi) All personal Systems (i.e., not company issued) that have access to Shopee Content (if permitted) must be configured to meet minimum security standards. Such Systems must not be used to Process Shopee Content, and periodically be disqualified staff or a wireless intrusion prevention system. Logs must be retained for twenty (20) days or more.

### 5.5
You will conduct, implement and maintain effective logical access controls that restrict access to Shopee Content by your personnel to a need-to-know basis and ensure that all accounts with access to Systems and networks used to access or management purposes. Shopee will be kept only with appropriate access controls over purpose systems devices and Systems. You should maintain an updated inventory record of all devices and Systems having access to the Platform and having access to or Processing Shopee Content at any time. You agree that you will designate at least one competent person who shall be responsible for overseeing all aspects of information security management within your company and liaise with Shopee in any matters relating to data access control and responding to any Security Breaches that arise in relation to Shopee Content at all times with the appropriate skill and knowledge to oversee the data-approved access points and act on due.

### 5.6
You must have logical access controls in place and all user privileges associated with the must occur within a segregated and secure access environment. As such

# Developer Guide - Security and Compliance Documentation

## 5. General Security

Wireless workgroups. Workstations with guest access are set up with wireless software and the device must be secure and long distances must be adhered to when using these workstations.

It You must prevent, detect, and address wireless security breaches, including those increasingly sophisticated to production environment. However, Stripe will not provide any Service-Level Agreements unless supporting pictures in production.

## 6. Systems Development and Maintenance

6.1 You must maintain documentation on overall system, network, and application architecture, data flows, process flows and security boundaries for all applications that Process or Store my Protected Data. You must regularly file an Architectural and Data Flow Questionnaire.

6.2 You must maintain system and software patch management processes to keep all systems and applications appropriately up to date. You must be responsible for verifying that all development staff have been successfully trained in secure programming and Stripe requires this verification.

6.3 You must maintain a robust Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) utilizing industry best-practice principles.

6.4 You will employ an effective, documented change management program with respect to services provided pursuant to Section 3 (Permitted Uses) hereof. Changes of any sort regarding production or production-supporting environments must undergo a defined change management process, including documentation, approval, and logging.

6.5 You must use internal and external networks substantially purse at least quarter parity and following any internal change processes, this includes networks where Processing occurs, and restrict access to only those individuals who need access for defined legitimate business purposes.

6.6 You will administer production environments using documented administrative procedures. If you have not deployed wireless access points, you must still contact this quarterly to update us on the current state of your networking environment. All security-associated reviews to identify common security vulnerabilities as identified by industry-recognized organizations, are not limited to common vulnerabilities as identified by OWASP Top 10 and/or CWE/SANS Top 25.

6.7 You shall ensure that software operating in production and test environments has been validated prior to deployment, on the basis of relevant security controls.

6.8 In all mobile applications that collect, transmit or display Shipper Content, you agree to conduct an application security assessment review to identify and remediate industry-recognized vulnerabilities specific to mobile applications.

6.9 You must maintain malware detection and prevention controls on systems and networks that Process or Store Shipper Content. In situations where malware is detected, you will ensure actions are taken to prevent a full impact or the infection spreading to other systems. You must maintain regularly-launched best-practices, and the associated policies is reviewed and approved by Shipper in writing. Maintenance logs shall be available upon request.

6.10 You must store all passwords in the approved, encrypted manner and will track logs and monitor whether there is a change to master credentials every 90 days. Shipper will not be liable or responsible for any loss or damage occasioned by non-compliance.

6.11 You computing environment according to a schedule predicated on the criticality of the patch. You must perform patch level assessments independently based upon required guidelines. Shipper reasonably verifies the security of the information resources through documentation. You shall not limit the liability of Shipper or impair its ability to exercise any rights or remedies now or hereafter available to us upon default.

## 7. Email Security

7.1 You will deploy and use, at years, appropriate email identity solutions will be utilized.

## 8. Security Assessments and Audits

8.1 You will audit and scan to choose a declaration of all Systems and key IT assets which Process and/or Store any Shipper Content. This declaration will include an up-to-date and accurate architectural depiction and inventory of all systems, infrastructure, and software utilized in the Processing or Storage of Shipper Content.

8.2 You agree to maintain a comprehensive vulnerability management program, including, but not limited to, the regular scanning of all systems for vulnerabilities in accordance with industry best practice.

8.3 You agree that Shipper may, from time to time, perform a security audit (i.e., vulnerability scans), of your Systems and infrastructure that Process or Store Shipper Content. All scans will be coordinated with you, but you will be required to implement scans as may be reasonably requested by Shipper.

8.4 In cases where Shipper Content is introduced into your environment, you agree to annual penetration testing on all externally- or internally-facing infrastructure.

8.5 You will provide upon reasonable notice, to allow your data processing facilities, procedures and documentation to be inspected and audited by Shipper or its designated third party in accordance with applicable laws. The DPO or any appropriate substitute or related personnel must be included in these audits and inspections. You agree to provide Shipper access to relevant documentation/personnel to conduct appropriate security reviews.

8.6 You will audit log and monitor access, on an ongoing basis, to relevant production systems used to Process and/or Store Shipper Content.

8.7 You will audit logs together with the security checks, audit efforts and requests from Shipper in accordance with the Service Level Agreement for the Services. Based on NIST industry-leading-practice, you will maintain industry standard log reviews and escalation procedures, and you will facilitate Shipper or its auditors in their review of such audit logs as may be available. In the event that Shipper auditors wish to review your logs and systems, such access must be available, and result in immediate identification of your use of the Services.

## 9. Incident Response and Notification Procedures

9.1 You shall have Effective information security incident response procedures in place for which (i) and protecting the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Shipper Content is an explicit, defined goal. As part of the information and all Shipper Content at risk, you must take all reasonable measures to mitigate the harmful effects of the Incident. You shall also conduct any other reasonable investigatory measures with regard to the Incident.

Procedures should include:

- (a) the identification of the Shipper Content which has been, or is reasonably believed to have been, under-accessed, impermissibly disclosed, or otherwise compromised;
- (b) notification to Shipper pursuant to these Terms;
- (c) in the event the Incident involves Service accounts or passwords, passwords will be appropriately disabled;
- (d) in the scope of the Incident, including a description of the type of Shipper Content involved in the Incident;
- (e) in short summary of the root causes (or an explanation of the information at the time of discovery, if the Incident is still being investigated);
- (f) whether the Shipper Content was encrypted; and
- (g) other information as Shipper may reasonably require.

You will provide such information within any timeframe as communicated reasonably in advance by Shipper for any accountable notice such as to provide cause overlapping to affected Data Subjects.

9.2 You will employ appropriate logging and monitoring of access to Shipper Content in order to facilitate investigations and forensic or audit Records. You will cooperate with Shipper in the identification and remediation of any applicable such as to provide cause overlapping to affected Data Subjects.

9.3 You will engage with Shipper as necessary in investigations and forensic in well-Managed incidents. You will cooperate with Shipper to determine whether notice must be provided to Data Subjects and/or Supervisory Authorities (and if so, timing and content) related to personal data processing in any Incident investigation. Upon conclusion of investigation, summary will be provided to Shipper.

Within the first 72 hours of detecting or being made aware of an Incident, you will provide us:

- (a) the nature of the Incident;
- (b) an indication of the Shipper Content, disclosed, or otherwise compromised or altered;
- (c) the likely consequences and severity of the Incident, including any actual or reasonably likely harm;
- (d) recommended measures to prevent recurrence and mitigate harm to the Data Subjects and Shipper; and
- (e) all efforts taken to mitigate the risks of further incidents.

## 10. Storage, Handling, and Disposal

9.4 You shall notify the Shipper completely and verify a recovery action plan, isolate, and disposal of any Shipper Content. Personal Data, Transmitted Data, and Restricted Content that is subject to this path.

10.1 You will ensure security disposal of Shipper Content is conduct free from cyber clients' data.

At the end of the Service pursuant to our agreement, or when otherwise requested to do so by Shipper, you will permanently and irretrievably, delete, destroy and/or return any Shipper Content and any output or material derived from your Processing of Shipper Content from storage and data processing systems where storage located is to be deleted or stored (wireless networks).

10.2 You will employ appropriate backup stored algorithms, with sufficiently generated keys' added to the input string stored in production. You agree to ensure backup facilities, backup media and restored credentials are located in a sufficiently secure location.

10.3 If any mobile devices used outside of a Data Center (e.g., a "laptop, desktop tablet) is perform any services pursuant to this Agreement.

10.4 If paper shredding and digital data, upon the disposal of it is to formatting (i.e., the wiping of storage media) should be stored at Data Centers consistent in overwriting (i.e., the wiping storage-persistent or wiping in which the content Guidance outlined in DoD or close to that following industry standards: ISO 27001; SSAE-18 or both; and, or PCI.

10.5 To demonstrate and prove that you will be fully and properly bound by the destruction of Shipper Content as described in this section and you will receive and retain written confirmation before Data is destroyed. Shipper may, from time to time, request a written certification showing that Shipper Content has been destroyed from your environment and destroy it within a reasonable timeframe, but no later than thirty (30) days after receipt from us.

You acknowledge and agree that:

- (a) transfer or destroy, as request in Section 10.1, all media used to store Protected Data; and
- (b) all portable devices or portable media supporting such Protected, destruction, and copy request otherwise as provided in this section 10, and you will not retain any such media. All destruction must be certified.

10.6 You will retain Shipper Content only for the minimum period required by this Agreement, taking into account the power that you and not using it to standard communications. Shipper will provide written notice requesting modification, and promptly return such media to Shipper, including but not limited to electronic mail, facsimile transmissions, text messages and instant messages supporting the Services.

10.7 In the event of termination of the Services or this Agreement, you will not modify the Shipper Content in any way available, and result in immediate termination of your use of the Services.

10.8 You agree to maintain copies are measured Data and Restricted Data (including but not limited to the Customer Name and passwords) physically segregated from other data, properly encrypted, and backed up in accordance with the terms set forth in the Agreement and in reasonable industry-standard methods. Shipper agrees to reasonably identify your rights for applicable data. Upon the expiry of the applicable retention period, all retained be disposed of in accordance with Clausul and destroyed in Section 10.

10.9 You shall dispose Transmitted Data and or Restricted Content from production environments in accordance with the Agreement or once the applicable legal retention period has expired, whichever is earlier, in a manner that ensures the data Security are completely destroyed and is irrecoverable using standard high-integrity disposal or in accordance with terms or reasonable at provisions and in line to reasonable as applicable.

Shipper must be notified of the completion of the disposal. Shipper reserves the right to review and request information directly and implement confirming Protected Data that is damaged or non-functional. All Protected Data must be rendered irrecoverable upon written by you and or written from that of destruction.

Shipper reserves the right to audit your disposal processes.

## 11. Ownership and Use

11.1 You acknowledge and agree that you have no ownership of, or right to use, Shipper Content other than as expressly set forth under an applicable legal agreement between you and Shipper. In the event an Incident, (including but not limited to unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or loss of Shipper Content), you must immediately notify Shipper and cooperate as expressly provided in the Terms of Service or as expressly authorized by Shipper in writing.

11.2 You will only use the Shipper Content as necessary to provide the Services and will not use or disclose Shipper Content for any purpose other than as specifically authorized by Shipper.

## 12. Payment Card Industry Compliance

12.1 If you Section 6's agree whenever you transmit, Process, handle, access, maintain, or store credit card holder's information, you have satisfied all requirements pursuant to the Terms of Service of any or such Applicable.

12.2 If you transmit, process, handle, access, maintain, or store credit card holder information on behalf of Shipper and/or if you share in the storage environment with Shipper's systems which transmit, process, access, handle, maintain or store credit card holder information, you must satisfy all applicable Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI-DSS) published by the PCI Security Standards Council. You must, if requested, provide written attestation of compliance, such as through a Report on Compliance (ROC) or Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ), appropriately attested to, that you have achieved the appropriate PCI-DSS requirements. You must also provide documentation for card-present, eCommerce, or mail order/ telephone order card-not-present environments, upon request. If you, or any of your users, directly, or cause the disclosure of any debit and credit card-holder's information in its possession, custody, or control, you will be solely liable.

## 13. Governing Law; Disputes

13.1 Use of the Platform and/or the Services will Steps Terms of Use shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable law.

13.2 Nothing in our Agreement prevents Shipper from bringing an action in a court of law with relevant jurisdiction for the purposes of seeking an order relating to the DPI, including any claims as to its formation, validity, existence, breach or termination, (each claim, a "Dispute"). Shipper may bring an action in a court of law with all applicable jurisdictions. The jurisdiction shall be that of the party bringing the action and the Parties expressly waive all claims or objections with respect to personal jurisdiction or venue. Any award or ruling resulting from the arbitration will be limited in its application solely to this Agreement; the use of this arbitration clause must not be construed as a waiver of any right to jury trial which may exist. Nothing in this Agreement, the arbitration clause must not be construed to the Courts of Ireland and Singapore. The arbitration clause shall consist of one arbitrator by and between the parties agreed or otherwise, if the parties cannot agree on the choice of an arbitrator within thirty (30) days after the dispute has arisen. If one arbitrator has been selected, then the arbitrator agreed upon by parties will be appointed, or if no agreement, will be appointed by the President of the Law Society of Ireland, whose shall be an active member of the Ireland, must must be chosen by the two arbitrators appointed by or on behalf of the Parties acting in concert with sixty (60) days from the date of appointment of the second arbitrator in the proceedings of the jurisdiction shall be English. The arbitration, including the making of the award, must be completed within ninety (90) calendar days from the appointment. The decision reached. The decision shall be final and binding on the Parties. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The arbitral award made shall guided by the arbitration tribunal shall be final and binding on both parties in the event the parties does not consolidate them or allow join to this agreement.

13.3 Nothing in this provision prevents Shipper's immediate recourse to the courts for injunctive relief.

## 14. Processing of Personal Data

---

# 14. Processing of Personal Data

14.1 You shall Process Personal Data in accordance with applicable laws, and at all times maintain, and ensure compliance with, privacy policies which meet the minimum standards under the applicable laws.

14.2 Prior to sharing any Personal Data with Shopee, you shall ensure that Data Subjects are appropriately notified of and have consented to Shopee's privacy practices. You warrant that you have a legitimate basis and adequate title to collect and share Personal Data with Shopee.

14.3 The following provisions shall apply to the Processing of Personal Data which was obtained or derived from any Shopee Content:

- (a) In relation to such Personal Data, as between you and Shopee, you are a data intermediary and shall Process the Personal Data on behalf of Shopee in accordance with this DPP.

- (b) You shall Process Personal Data only to the extent, and in such manner, as is required to develop, operate and maintain your Applications in accordance with the Terms of Service and Shopee's written instructions.

- (c) You are authorised to use Sub-processors, provided that you (i) enter into an agreement with the Sub-processor imposing data protection obligations on the Sub-processor that are at least as restrictive as the obligations under this DPP, (ii) undertake to provide a copy of the aforesaid agreement to Shopee promptly upon request, and (iii) shall remain liable for any act or omission of any Sub-processor that does not comply with the requirements of this DPP.

- (d) You shall not cause or permit any Personal Data to be transferred across borders in breach of applicable laws. Cross-border transfers of Personal Data subject to legal restrictions by applicable laws shall require Shopee's prior written consent. For the avoidance of doubt, this transfer restriction does not pertain to Shopee personnel access to Personal Data.

- (e) To the extent legally permitted, you shall immediately notify Shopee in writing upon receipt of an order, demand, or document purporting to request, demand or compel the production of Personal Data to any third party. You shall not disclose Personal Data to the third party without providing Shopee at least forty-eight (48) hours' notice, so that Shopee may, at its own expense, exercise such rights as it may have under applicable laws to prevent or limit such disclosure. Notwithstanding the foregoing, you will exercise commercially reasonable efforts to prevent and limit any such disclosure and to otherwise preserve the confidentiality of Personal Data; additionally, you will cooperate with Shopee with respect to any action taken pursuant to such order, demand, or other document request, including to obtain an appropriate protective order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to Personal Data.

- (f) You agree that Shopee may for any reason, in its sole discretion and with or without notice or liability to you, immediately suspend or terminate your Account or access to the Platform and Services, remove or discard from the Site any Content associated with your Account, and/or take any other actions that Shopee deems necessary to protect itself and any Protected Data. Grounds for such actions may include, but are not limited to, actual or suspected (a) extended periods of inactivity, (b) violation of the letter or spirit of this DPP, (c) security failures by you, including failure to cooperate in any security audit or to take reasonable remediation steps required by Shopee, (d) any data leakage or loss attributable to you or your clients, or (e) any other behaviour that is harmful to Shopee's Users, third parties, or the business interests of Shopee. Use of an Account for illegal, fraudulent, harassing, defamatory, threatening or abusive purposes may be referred to law enforcement authorities without notice to you. Without limitation to any other remedy available, if a legal dispute arises or law enforcement action or other regulatory inquiry is commenced relating to your Account or your use of the Services for any reason, Shopee may terminate your Account immediately with or without notice.

- (g) Without limitation to any other remedy or indemnity available under the Terms of Service, you agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Shopee, and its shareholders, subsidiaries, affiliates, directors, officers, agents, co-branders or other partners, and employees (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all loss, claims, actions, proceedings, and suits and all related liabilities, damages, settlements, penalties, fines, costs and expenses (including, without limitation, any other dispute resolution expenses) incurred by Shopee or any Indemnified Party arising out of or relating to, without limitation, (a) your violation or breach of any term of this DPP or any policy or guidelines referenced herein, (b) your use or misuse of the Platform, any Shopee Content, Restricted Data, Protected Data and/or Personal Data, and (c) your breach of any law or any rights of a third party, including any applicable data protection laws.

# 15. Effective Period

Your obligations and Shopee's rights under this DPP shall become effective from the date you access the Platform, and will continue in effect until the termination of the Terms of Service and for any period thereafter during which you and your personnel have possession of or access to any Protected Data.

metadata.title: Shopee Open Platform Data Protection Policy
metadata.summary: This guide outlines the data protection and information security standards required for developers integrating with the Shopee Open Platform. It defines key terms related to data protection and specifies restrictions on data handling to ensure compliance and security.
use_cases: Developing applications using the Shopee Open Platform
Handling user data within the Shopee ecosystem
Ensuring compliance with Shopee's data protection policies
Responding to security incidents involving Shopee data
